source_note: State baseline derived from New Hampshire DES Solid Waste Management Program; recycling handled at local level.

organics.guidance: Composting and organics diversion encouraged under DES rules; not required statewide.
organics.bin: Green/yard waste bin or compost site.
provenance: NH DES Solid Waste Management Program

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue/mixed recycling bin or transfer station drop-off.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle clean aluminum and steel/tin cans.

plastics.guidance: Recycle bottles and containers labeled #1â€“#2; acceptance of others varies locally.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: New Hampshire does not have a bottle deposit system.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Recycle curbside or at transfer station.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries via HHW programs.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of regular trash.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste accepted at transfer stations or special events; no statewide mandate.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags and film not accepted curbside.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return to retail store collection bins.

bulky_items.guidance: Bring bulky waste to landfill or transfer station.
bulky_items.notes: Fees apply by volume or item.
